overview: This subject introduces Jazz & Improvisation students to advanced harmonic concepts and techniques.
Through practical performance activities, deep listening exercises and transcription, students acquire tools to creatively navigate highly chromatic and atonal environments as players and listeners.
This subject is only available to students enrolled in theJazz and Improvisationmajor of the B-MUS Bachelor of Music.
intended learning outcomes: perform highly chromatic and atonal melodies, and harmonic structures;
transcribe highly chromatic and atonal melodies, and harmonic structures;
aurally distinguish intervals in highly chromatic and atonal performance contexts.

additional pre-requisite: Admission into the Jazz & Improvisation major in the B-MUS Bachelor of Music

non-allowed subjects: MUSI30238 Advanced Harmonic and Rhythmic Studies

assessments.description: One 3-minute viva voce practical demonstration (video submission). 7.5 hours (of work required)
Transcribe a 2 to 3-minute piece of music. 17.5 hours (of work required)
One 5-minute performance of a transcription along with the original recording. 12.5 hours (of work required)
One notated transcription with accompanying analysis, equivalent to 500 words. 12.5 hours (of work required)
Hurdle requirement:. Students must attend a minimum of 80% of all scheduled classes and performances as directed.

Semester 1.Contact hours: 12 hours, comprising one 1-hour practical class per week

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
